page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT
page.content:
{INDUSTRY:} The biggest loss to Antrim was its main industry.Many families moved to Antrim around 1963 to seek employment in the British Enkalon factory.The company employed 3103 in 1971.Because of a slump on the world market the company closed. Recently a second firm "The Lear Fan Aircraft Company"took over part of the Enkalon plant and hoped to offer employment to people in the area.In May 1985 this company ceased trading also.
{FUTURE DEVOLOPMENT: }A new 2000 bed hospital is being developed. This should boost employment in Antrim.
